Political opponents don’t have to be enemies.   Last night my opponent Uriah Luallin & I got together. We talked politics travel congress & family. No one yelled & no food fight broke out.   It was just two people who love their country having a conversation. https://t.co/WtHs4mDoPz

I just finished “Calvin Coolidge in the Black Hills.” It is a throughly fun read in part because of the President’s unique demeanor but also because of @SethTupper’s writing. Great stories about Gov Bulow car ride trout fishing student preacher Haley affair. Recommend. https://t.co/J1FuLtj0U2

You‘ve never given me benefit of doubt but do you see why concerns re: availability of poll workers & the need to sanitize regularly might have caused me to encourage people to vote early?

Day 10 - During his first year in office two of Dusty's bills were signed into law. https://t.co/zSKolcs1Rk
@DustysPinkTie @RepDustyJohnson @DonaldPayneJr Woah.
Day 9 - Dusty worked with the administration to establish work requirements for able-bodied adults on food stamps.  https://t.co/k4ixfjYD5w
Day 8 - Dusty wrote a bipartisan bill to push back against the EPA’s overreaching regulations and waivers that hurt #biofuels. https://t.co/C7xfdDxJlp

Day 7 - Dusty fought for fair trade deals for South Dakota's farmers and ranchers. He was on the whip team that helped get President Trump's USCMA trade deal across the finish line - this deal is expected to add thousands of new jobs.   https://t.co/YgFTtcEGUd
Dusty’s said hello to hundreds of friends at the Summit League Tournament! https://t.co/6ZK4g7nuXo

Day 6 - South Dakota is home to thousands of responsible sportsmen and gun owners - that's why Dusty opposed gun control legislation that would make it a federal crime to loan a hunting shotgun to a friend. https://t.co/4B0rEAGV2k
We will continue to stay on top of this issue. Bringing more “truth in labeling” to beef would be a big win for consumers and producers alike.   https://t.co/gcIRQGZiDr new-beef-labeling-standards/

Day 5 - Dusty is a steady conservative voice for South Dakota. He voted against impeachment the Green New Deal illegal immigrants voting in elections and dozens of burdensome regulations. https://t.co/P5Z4YhMREr
Day 4 - Dusty was on the whip team that led efforts to secure bipartisan votes for @realDonaldTrump's #USMCA trade deal which was ultimately signed into law by the president. https://t.co/lnowRyxNN3
@DustysPinkTie Don’t do it. I’m not worth it.

Day 3 - Dusty voted against budget deals that didn’t do enough to address government spending and our $23 trillion national debt. RT if you want Congress to get control of its spending! https://t.co/roHIRmNprJ

Day 2 - Dusty saw the crisis at the border firsthand - that's why he supported billions for the border wall & border security during his first year in office.  @realDonaldTrump wants to see 400 miles of wall done by the end of 2020 - RT if you support!   https://t.co/8NLwdSTQDa

Day 1 - Dusty worked hard to get a seat on the Ag Committee for our producers. Dusty successfully worked with USDA to move the prevent plant harvest date to Sept. 1 and was named the top Republican on the subcommittee that oversees USDA. https://t.co/YDlmr9d64I

Dusty is working hard for South Dakota and actions speak louder than words. Over the next few days stay tuned for what Dusty's been fighting for during his first year in Congress. https://t.co/4kePdWykpb
Thanks for your kind words SD Stockgrowers. Dusty looks forward to working with you on this issue!   https://t.co/ZywzeUpgHA
